header_summary:
Ethan Heilman introduces a new Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) that adds a FOLDFUNCTIONSTREAM opcode to the Bitcoin scripting system, aiming to enhance script functionality and safety by allowing complex operations like hashing over concatenated strings without unbounded memory growth. This proposal, which includes defined fold functions for various computational tasks and a structured deployment plan, seeks to address long-standing challenges in Bitcoin's scripting capabilities, with a reference implementation available on [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/XXX).

Bruno has developed a mutation testing tool for Bitcoin Core, hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/brunoerg/mutation-core), which focuses on testing only the code altered in a specific branch to improve efficiency and identify vulnerabilities. This tool utilizes security-based mutation operators for fuzz testing and supports mutations in functional tests to ensure robust software against unexpected inputs, streamlining the testing process for developers.

T-bast discusses the importance of using a unique `invreq_payer_id` for each contact to enhance privacy and security in cryptographic communications, emphasizing domain separation to mitigate risks associated with privacy breaches and security threats. Meanwhile, rustaceanrob proposes a standardized Wallet Descriptor Export File (WDEF) format to simplify the wallet recovery process, supporting drag-and-drop functionality and encapsulating all necessary wallet data, with a [reference implementation in Rust](https://github.com/rustaceanrob/wdef) seeking community feedback to refine the recovery process and standard.

recent_posts.title: Publishing text of 2017-era proposed Bitcoin opcode OP_FFS (Fold Function Stream)
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP introduces FOLDFUNCTIONSTREAM, enhancing Bitcoin scripts with efficient data processing.
- It specifies activation via BIP9, ensuring phased, tested deployment across networks.
- Technical and safety deliberations are included, with further details on a GitHub pull request.

recent_posts.title: Mutation-core: A mutation testing tool for Bitcoin Core
recent_posts.summary:
- A new Bitcoin Core mutation testing tool is available on GitHub for developer testing.
- The tool emphasizes efficiency and precision by generating mutants for recently modified or added code.
- It also supports security-based mutation testing and efficiency in CI/CD pipelines, encouraging community feedback.

recent_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
recent_posts.summary:
- Utilizing a unique `invreq_payer_id` for each contact improves privacy and security.
- Domain separation is the primary reason for this approach, reducing privacy and security risks.
- Frequent use of keys for cryptographic signatures necessitates strict data protection measures.

recent_posts.title: File Format for Recovering Descriptor Wallets
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a standardized Wallet Descriptor Export File (WDEF) to ease wallet recovery.
- WDEF aims to unify storing and sharing of wallet metadata, reducing recovery complexities.
- Feedback is sought on the WDEF format, with a reference implementation in Rust available for testing.

active_posts.title: OP_CAT Research Fund sponsored by StarkWare
active_posts.summary:
- StarkWare announces a $1 million bounty for opinions on OP_CAT's activation.
- The initiative is overseen by a committee including figures from Blockstream and Lightning Labs.
- It aims to foster community discussions on OP_CAT's impact on Bitcoin's ecosystem.

active_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes creating "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes on Bitcoin's mainnet for real-world attack tests.
- He addresses criticisms of the complexity in full-node and lightning software, aiming for transparency in protocol security.
- The initiative seeks to demonstrate attack feasibilities publicly, countering private test limitations and enhancing community trust.

active_posts.title: Proposal to upgrade the transaction relay protocol to a new version
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposed a major Bitcoin transaction relay protocol enhancement.
- The proposal aims to improve transaction propagation efficiency and security.
- Community feedback is encouraged to align the upgrade with scalability and security goals.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improvements to the Bitcoin protocol, including addressing the timewarp vulnerability.
- It proposes adjustments to combat non-SegWit transaction risks and enhance network efficiency.
- Community debate emerges over the suggestion to reduce block size, impacting scalability.

active_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
active_posts.summary:
- The SV2 extension is being developed to improve mining pool payout transparency and fairness.
- It allows miners to choose transactions, offering various fee structure jobs within PPLNS.
- The project seeks reviews and contributions, with details available on GitHub.

active_posts.title: Non interactive anti-exfil (airgap compatible)
active_posts.summary:
- The mail details a cryptographic scheme for secure transaction signing with hardware signers.
- It introduces `vector_commit` for flexibility across cryptographic standards like bip340 and ecdsa.
- The scheme simplifies the process by allowing direct secret transmission, enhancing overall security.

today_in_history_posts.title: Year 2038 problem and year 2106 chain halting
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core may stop working in 2038 due to a potential issue.
- The entire chain will halt in 2106 after reaching median time 0xffffffff.
- There's uncertainty if a soft-fork can resolve these problems, affecting Bitcoin's future.

today_in_history_posts.title: Stateless invoices with proof-of-payment
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Stateless lightning invoices eliminate the need for storage by not keeping any state.
- Two main issues with stateless invoices are identifying payment purpose and settling transactions.
- Solutions include using custom tlv records or a deterministic preimage for invoice processing.

today_in_history_posts.title: Covenant tools softfork
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposed softfork aims to enhance Bitcoin with new security and efficiency features.
- BIP-118, BIP-119, and BIP-345 are central to these upgrades, supporting a range of applications.
- The implementation, requiring review of 7,000 lines of code, seeks community consensus for activation.
